architectural_notes: Backend call to canister method _initializeAccessControlWithSecret can fail if target IC canister is stopped (IC0508 non_replicated_rejection).
known_issues: Console error IC0508: Canister acg2y-eiaaa-aaaab-aan7a-cai is stopped, causing initialization/access control setup to fail and UI to show generic 'Something went wrong'.
Warning: createActor called with both agent and agentOptions; agentOptions ignored.

existing_features.title: Detect the specific Internet Computer rejection case where the backend canister is stopped (e.g., reject_message contains "is stopped" / error_code "IC0508") during authenticated actor initialization (including `_initializeAccessControlWithSecret`) and surface a clear, user-friendly error message in the UI instead of the generic "Something Went Wrong".

Update error sanitization / formatting so that stopped-canister errors are categorized and converted into stable English user-facing text (while still logging the raw error to the console for debugging).

Eliminate the runtime warning "Detected both agent and agentOptions passed to createActor. Ignoring agentOptions and proceeding with the provided agent." by ensuring actor creation only passes one of `agent` or `agentOptions` (not both) when calling `createActorWithConfig`.

Prevent duplicated access-control initialization calls during app startup by consolidating authenticated actor initialization behind the guarded path (so `_initializeAccessControlWithSecret` is not triggered redundantly by multiple actor hooks).

projectName: Fix profile load failure when backend canister is stopped and remove createActor agentOptions warning
